items.title: Awesome Blazor
items.content_text:
### Videos / Others

*   [Modern Full-Stack Web Development with ASP.NET Core & Blazor](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NbfhbDKiFpM) - ![duration](https://img.shields.io/badge/Duration:%20-41%20min-%230094FF?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=maxAge\&logo=youtube) May 22, 2024 - Dive into the latest advancements in ASP.NET Core and Blazor for building dynamic, responsive full-stack web applications. Learn how these powerful frameworks simplify the development process, from server to client, enabling you to create rich interactive web UIs with C# instead of JavaScript.
*   [Clean Architecture with .NET MAUI, Blazor, and ASP.NET Core](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=u9YNufaYxzM) - ![duration](https://img.shields.io/badge/Duration:%20-67%20min-%230094FF?style=flat-square\&cacheSeconds=maxAge\&logo=youtube) May 22, 2024 - We've heard a lot about how using .NET to build our UI applications lets us share code across our whole stack, but finding the best way to do this isn't straightforward. UI code and API code can sometimes seem at cross-purposes and it's not always obvious how using .NET code across your whole stack provides any advantages over using different technologies for your UI and API. It's easy to fall into the trap of underutilizing the right code-sharing techniques. Or, at the other extreme, butchering your architecture for the sake of sharing code. In this talk, Matt Goldman (author of .NET MAUI in Action) will look at extending Clean Architecture to incorporate UIs built with .NET MAUI and Blazor. See sensible ways to write clean, testable, re-usable code that can be shared across the different layers of your solution, and across different solutions in your enterprise, to optimize efficiency and minimize duplication. We'll also see how to avoid the common pitfalls of over-engineering or under-sharing. You will walk away knowing how to make full-stack code shared with .NET a reality.

### Articles / Others

*   [Blazor in .NET 9 Takes Shape (Preview 4 Highlights)](https://www.telerik.com/blogs/blazor-net-9-takes-shape-preview-4-highlights) - June 4, 2024 - .NET 9 is shaping up ahead of its November 2024 release. Here are the highlights for Blazor so far.
items.content_html:
Videos / Others

  • Modern Full-Stack Web Development with ASP.NET Core & Blazor - May 22, 2024 - Dive into the latest advancements in ASP.NET Core and Blazor for building dynamic, responsive full-stack web applications. Learn how these powerful frameworks simplify the development process, from server to client, enabling you to create rich interactive web UIs with C# instead of JavaScript.
  • Clean Architecture with .NET MAUI, Blazor, and ASP.NET Core - May 22, 2024 - We've heard a lot about how using .NET to build our UI applications lets us share code across our whole stack, but finding the best way to do this isn't straightforward. UI code and API code can sometimes seem at cross-purposes and it's not always obvious how using .NET code across your whole stack provides any advantages over using different technologies for your UI and API. It's easy to fall into the trap of underutilizing the right code-sharing techniques. Or, at the other extreme, butchering your architecture for the sake of sharing code. In this talk, Matt Goldman (author of .NET MAUI in Action) will look at extending Clean Architecture to incorporate UIs built with .NET MAUI and Blazor. See sensible ways to write clean, testable, re-usable code that can be shared across the different layers of your solution, and across different solutions in your enterprise, to optimize efficiency and minimize duplication. We'll also see how to avoid the common pitfalls of over-engineering or under-sharing. You will walk away knowing how to make full-stack code shared with .NET a reality.

Articles / Others

  • Blazor in .NET 9 Takes Shape (Preview 4 Highlights) - June 4, 2024 - .NET 9 is shaping up ahead of its November 2024 release. Here are the highlights for Blazor so far.

items.title: Awesome Browser Extensions for Github
items.content_text: ### [GitHub Highlight Selected (‚≠ê144)](https://github.com/Nuclides/github-highlight-selected) Highlight selected word in GitHub source view like Sublime Text. Installs: 1000 | Stars: 144 | Last update: n/a ### [OctoPermalinker (‚≠ê29)](https://github.com/josephfrazier/octopermalinker) OctoPermalinker is a browser extension that searches GitHub comments/files for links to files on branches, and adds a link to where the branch pointed when the comment/file was made/updated. This helps you avoid following a link that was broken after being posted. For context, here's some discussion about broken GitHub links: [Don't link to line numbers in GitHub](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=8046710). For example, suppose you're looking at a gist that links to a file on the master branch of a repo. At the time the gist was made, the link worked, but if the file gets removed, the link is broken. OctoPermalinker uses the gist creation date to add a permalink that still works. Installs: 232 | Stars: 27 | Last update: n/a
items.content_html:
GitHub Highlight Selected (‚≠ê144)

Highlight selected word in GitHub source view like Sublime Text.

Installs: 1000 | Stars: 144 | Last update: n/a

OctoPermalinker (‚≠ê29)

OctoPermalinker is a browser extension that searches GitHub comments/files for links to files on branches, and adds a link to where the branch pointed when the comment/file was made/updated. This helps you avoid following a link that was broken after being posted. For context, here's some discussion about broken GitHub links: Don't link to line numbers in GitHub.

For example, suppose you're looking at a gist that links to a file on the master branch of a repo. At the time the gist was made, the link worked, but if the file gets removed, the link is broken. OctoPermalinker uses the gist creation date to add a permalink that still works.

Installs: 232 | Stars: 27 | Last update: n/a

items.title: Free for Dev
items.content_text:
### Tools for Teams and Collaboration

*   [transfernow](https://www.transfernow.net/) ‚Äî simplest, fastest and safest interface to transfer and share files. Send photos, videos and other large files without a manditory subscription.
*   [paste.sh](https://paste.sh/) ‚Äî This is a JavaScript and the Crypto based simple paste site.

### Education and Career Development

*   [Roadmap.sh](https://roadmap.sh) - Free learning roadmaps covering all aspects of development from Blockchain to UX Design.

### Forms

*   [Survicate](https://survicate.com/) ‚Äî Pull feedback from all sources and send follow-up surveys with one tool. Automatically analyze feedback and extract insights with AI. Free email, website, in-product or mobile surveys, AI survey creator, and 25 monthly responses.

items.title: Awesome Gnome
items.content_text:
### Office

*   [Morphosis](https://flathub.org/apps/garden.jamie.Morphosis) - Document converter (using Pandoc) supporting PDF, Markdown, RST, LaTeX, HTML, Microsoft Word, Open/Libre Office and EPUB formats.

### Gaming

*   [Chess Clock](https://flathub.org/apps/com.clarahobbs.chessclock) - Timer for over-the-board chess games.
*   [Crosswords](https://flathub.org/apps/org.gnome.Crosswords) - Game of crosswords with squpport for shaped and colors crosswords and `.ipuz`, `.jpuz`, `.xd`, and `.puz` files.
*   [Mahjongg](https://flathub.org/apps/org.gnome.Mahjongg) - Solitaire (one player) version of the classic Eastern tile game, Mahjongg.
*   [Ultimate Tic Tac Toe](https://flathub.org/apps/io.github.nokse22.ultimate-tic-tac-toe) - [Ultimate Tic Tac Toe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ultimate_tic-tac-toe) to play with friends or against an AI.

### Utilities

*   [Snoop](https://flathub.org/apps/de.philippun1.Snoop) - Application (with Nautilus extension) to search through file contents in a given folder.
items.content_html:
Office

  • Morphosis - Document converter (using Pandoc) supporting PDF, Markdown, RST, LaTeX, HTML, Microsoft Word, Open/Libre Office and EPUB formats.

Gaming

  • Chess Clock - Timer for over-the-board chess games.
  • Crosswords - Game of crosswords with squpport for shaped and colors crosswords and .ipuz, .jpuz, .xd, and .puz files.
  • Mahjongg - Solitaire (one player) version of the classic Eastern tile game, Mahjongg.
  • Ultimate Tic Tac Toe - Ultimate Tic Tac Toe to play with friends or against an AI.

Utilities

  • Snoop - Application (with Nautilus extension) to search through file contents in a given folder.

items.title: Awesome Go
items.content_text:
### Configuration

*   [confiq (‚≠ê38)](https://github.com/greencoda/confiq) - Structured data format to config struct decoder library for Go - supporting multiple data formats
*   [go-array (‚≠ê20)](https://github.com/deatil/go-array) - A Go package that read or set data from map, slice or json.
*   [GoCfg (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/Jagerente/gocfg) - Config manager with Struct Tags based contracts, custom value providers, parsers, and documentation generation. Customizable yet simple.

### NoSQL Database Drivers

*   [go-mongox (‚≠ê201)](https://github.com/chenmingyong0423/go-mongox) - A Go Mongo library based on the official driver, featuring streamlined document operations, generic binding of structs to collections, built-in CRUD, aggregation, automated field updates, struct validation, hooks, and plugin-based programming.
*   [mgm (‚≠ê760)](https://github.com/kamva/mgm) - MongoDB model-based ODM for Go (based on official MongoDB driver).
*   [mgo (‚≠ê2k)](https://github.com/globalsign/mgo) - (unmaintained) MongoDB driver for the Go language that implements a rich and well tested selection of features under a very simple API following standard Go idioms.
*   [mongo-go-driver (‚≠ê8.4k)](https://github.com/mongodb/mongo-go-driver) - Official MongoDB driver for the Go language.

### Distributed Systems

*   [capillaries (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/capillariesio/capillaries) - distributed batch data processing framework.

### Embeddable Scripting Languages

*   [goal](https://codeberg.org/anaseto/goal) - An embeddable scripting array language.

### Machine Learning

*   [hugot (‚≠ê430)](https://github.com/knights-analytics/hugot) - Huggingface transformer pipelines for golang with onnxruntime.

### Utilities

*   [gitcs (‚≠ê123)](https://github.com/knbr13/gitcs/) - Git Commits Visualizer, CLI tool to visualize your Git commits on your local machine.

### Web Frameworks

*   [Fastschema (‚≠ê481)](https://github.com/fastschema/fastschema) - A flexible Go web framework and Headless CMS.
*   [Gone (‚≠ê131)](https://github.com/gone-io/gone) - A lightweight dependency injection and web framework inspired by Spring.

### WebAssembly / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [Extism Go SDK (‚≠ê125)](https://github.com/extism/go-sdk) - Universal, cross-language WebAssembly framework for building plug-in systems and polyglot apps.

### DevOps Tools / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

*   [KusionStack (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/KusionStack/kusion) - A unified programmable configuration techstack to deliver modern app in 'platform as code' and 'infra as code' approach.
items.content_html:
Configuration

  • confiq (‚≠ê38) - Structured data format to config struct decoder library for Go - supporting multiple data formats
  • go-array (‚≠ê20) - A Go package that read or set data from map, slice or json.
  • GoCfg (‚≠ê6) - Config manager with Struct Tags based contracts, custom value providers, parsers, and documentation generation. Customizable yet simple.

NoSQL Database Drivers

  • go-mongox (‚≠ê201) - A Go Mongo library based on the official driver, featuring streamlined document operations, generic binding of structs to collections, built-in CRUD, aggregation, automated field updates, struct validation, hooks, and plugin-based programming.
  • mgm (‚≠ê760) - MongoDB model-based ODM for Go (based on official MongoDB driver).
  • mgo (‚≠ê2k) - (unmaintained) MongoDB driver for the Go language that implements a rich and well tested selection of features under a very simple API following standard Go idioms.
  • mongo-go-driver (‚≠ê8.4k) - Official MongoDB driver for the Go language.

Distributed Systems

  • capillaries (‚≠ê66) - distributed batch data processing framework.

Embeddable Scripting Languages

  • goal - An embeddable scripting array language.

Machine Learning

  • hugot (‚≠ê430) - Huggingface transformer pipelines for golang with onnxruntime.

Utilities

  • gitcs (‚≠ê123) - Git Commits Visualizer, CLI tool to visualize your Git commits on your local machine.

Web Frameworks

  • Fastschema (‚≠ê481) - A flexible Go web framework and Headless CMS.
  • Gone (‚≠ê131) - A lightweight dependency injection and web framework inspired by Spring.

WebAssembly / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

  • Extism Go SDK (‚≠ê125) - Universal, cross-language WebAssembly framework for building plug-in systems and polyglot apps.

DevOps Tools / Libraries for creating HTTP middlewares

  • KusionStack (‚≠ê1.1k) - A unified programmable configuration techstack to deliver modern app in 'platform as code' and 'infra as code' approach.

items.title: Awesome Cl
items.content_text:
### Machine Learning

*   [openai-openapi-client](https://codeberg.org/kilianmh/openai-openapi-client) - semi-automatically generated Openapi client updated frequently from the [official Openapi specification (‚≠ê2.1k)](https://github.com/openai/openai-openapi/blob/master/openapi.yaml). AGPL-3.
    *   available on Ultralisp.
*   [cl-completions (‚≠ê19)](https://github.com/atgreen/cl-completions) - LLM completions.
    *   makes it easy to create GPT functions in Common Lisp.
    *   Ollama support.
*   [cl-embeddings (‚≠ê10)](https://github.com/atgreen/cl-embeddings) - LLM embeddings.

### YAML

*   [cl-hash-util (‚≠ê30)](https://github.com/orthecreedence/cl-hash-util) - Hash-table creation, access, and manipulation utilities. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).

### Clojure

*   [clj-arrows (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/dtenny/clj-arrows) -  Clojure-compatible threading/transformation/arrow macros for Common Lisp.
*   [with-redefs (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/dtenny/with-redefs) - enables rebinding of global functions, inspired by Clojure's with-redefs.

### Miscellaneous

*   [pngload-fast (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/lisp-mirror/pngload) - A PNG (Portable Network Graphics) image format decoder in portable Common Lisp with an emphasis on speed. [MIT](https://opensource.org/licenses/MIT).

### Pattern matching

*   ‚≠ê [trivia (‚≠ê349)](https://github.com/guicho271828/trivia/) - Optimized pattern-matching library. [LLGPL](http://opensource.franz.com/preamble.html).

### Beginner

*   [Loving Common Lisp, or the Savvy Programmer's Secret Weapon](https://leanpub.com/lovinglisp) - Quick introduction to Common Lisp with many examples. A particular focus is on how to use Large Language Models (LLMs).

### Advanced

*   [Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming: Case Studies in Common Lisp](http://norvig.com/paip.html) - A book on programming AI that covers some advanced Lisp.
    *   with a web version: [https://norvig.github.io/paip-lisp/](https://norvig.github.io/paip-lisp/#/)
    *   [PAIP-lisp (‚≠ê7.3k)](https://github.com/norvig/paip-lisp) -  Lisp code for the textbook "Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming".

### Job processing / Third-party APIs

*   [rexxparse (‚≠ê11)](https://github.com/dtenny/rexxparse) -  A string parsing tool inspired by the REXX PARSE construct. MIT.
items.content_html:
Machine Learning

  • openai-openapi-client - semi-automatically generated Openapi client updated frequently from the official Openapi specification (‚≠ê2.1k). AGPL-3.
    • available on Ultralisp.
  • cl-completions (‚≠ê19) - LLM completions.
    • makes it easy to create GPT functions in Common Lisp.
    • Ollama support.
  • cl-embeddings (‚≠ê10) - LLM embeddings.

YAML

  • cl-hash-util (‚≠ê30) - Hash-table creation, access, and manipulation utilities. MIT.

Clojure

  • clj-arrows (‚≠ê11) - Clojure-compatible threading/transformation/arrow macros for Common Lisp.
  • with-redefs (‚≠ê1) - enables rebinding of global functions, inspired by Clojure's with-redefs.

Miscellaneous

  • pngload-fast (‚≠ê1) - A PNG (Portable Network Graphics) image format decoder in portable Common Lisp with an emphasis on speed. MIT.

Pattern matching

  • ‚≠ê trivia (‚≠ê349) - Optimized pattern-matching library. LLGPL.

Beginner

  • Loving Common Lisp, or the Savvy Programmer's Secret Weapon - Quick introduction to Common Lisp with many examples. A particular focus is on how to use Large Language Models (LLMs).

Advanced

  • Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming: Case Studies in Common Lisp - A book on programming AI that covers some advanced Lisp.
    • with a web version: https://norvig.github.io/paip-lisp/
    • PAIP-lisp (‚≠ê7.3k) - Lisp code for the textbook "Paradigms of Artificial Intelligence Programming".

Job processing / Third-party APIs

  • rexxparse (‚≠ê11) - A string parsing tool inspired by the REXX PARSE construct. MIT.

items.title: Awesome Mysql
items.content_text:
### Analysis

*   [Prometheus (‚≠ê59k)](https://github.com/prometheus/prometheus)/[mysqld\_exporter (‚≠ê2.3k)](https://github.com/prometheus/mysqld_exporter) - Time series database for real-time monitoring and alerting.

### Benchmarking

*   [iibench-mysql (‚≠ê46)](https://github.com/tmcallaghan/iibench-mysql) - Java based version of the Index Insertion Benchmark for MySQL/Percona/MariaDB.

### Connectors

*   [DBD::MariaDB (‚≠ê35)](https://github.com/perl5-dbi/DBD-MariaDB) - MariaDB and MySQL driver for the Perl5 Database Interface.
*   [DBD::mysql (‚≠ê64)](https://github.com/perl5-dbi/DBD-mysql) - MySQL driver for the Perl5 Database Interface.
*   [MariaDB Connector/J (‚≠ê350)](https://github.com/mariadb-corporation/mariadb-connector-j) - LGPL-licensed MariaDB Client Library for Java Applications.
*   [MySQL C API](https://dev.mysql.com/downloads/c-api/) - Official C driver for MySQL.
*   [MySQL Connector/C++ (‚≠ê677)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-cpp) - Official C/C++ driver for MySQL.
*   [MySQL Connector/J (‚≠ê964)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-j) - a standardized database driver for the Java platforms and development.
*   [MySQL Connector/NET (‚≠ê309)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-net) - a standardized database driver for .Net platforms and development.
*   [MySQL Connector/Node.js (‚≠ê158)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-nodejs) - Official Node.js driver for MySQL.
*   [MySQL Connector/Python (‚≠ê913)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-connector-python) - a standardized database driver for Python platforms and development.
*   [mysqlclient-python (‚≠ê2.5k)](https://github.com/PyMySQL/mysqlclient) - MySQL database connector for Python.
*   [PHP mysqlnd](https://www.php.net/manual/en/book.mysqlnd.php) - MySQL native driver for PHP.

### Deployment

*   [dbdeployer (‚≠ê712)](https://github.com/datacharmer/dbdeployer) (archived) - A tool that installs one or more MySQL servers within seconds, easily, securely, and with full control.

### Development

*   [Flywaydb (‚≠ê8.9k)](https://github.com/flyway/flyway) - Database migrations; Evolve your database schema easily and reliably across all your instances
*   [Liquibase (‚≠ê5.1k)](https://github.com/liquibase/liquibase) - Source control for your database
*   [Skeema (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/skeema/skeema) - Declarative pure-SQL schema management system for MySQL and MariaDB, with support for sharding and external online schema change tools
*   [SQLE (‚≠ê1.4k)](https://github.com/actiontech/sqle/blob/main/README_en.md) - SQLE is a SQL audit platform for DBA or developer

### GUI

*   [Adminer (‚≠ê6.9k)](https://github.com/vrana/adminer/) - Database management in a single PHP file.
*   [DBeaver (‚≠ê44k)](https://github.com/dbeaver/dbeaver/) - A cross-platform SQL and NoSQL database client.
*   [HeidiSQL (‚≠ê5.3k)](https://github.com/HeidiSQL/HeidiSQL) - MySQL GUI frontend for Windows.
*   [MySQL Shell (‚≠ê206)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-shell/) - Advanced client and code editor for MySQL that supports development and administration for the MySQL Server and MySQL InnoDB cluster (AdminAPI) with an interactive JavaScript, Python, or SQL interface.
*   [MySQL Workbench (‚≠ê950)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-workbench) - provides DBAs and developers an integrated tools environment for database design & modeling; SQL devleopment; database administration.
*   [OmniDB: Web tool for database management (‚≠ê3.2k)](https://github.com/OmniDB/OmniDB)
*   [Percona Monitoring and Management (‚≠ê797)](https://github.com/percona/pmm) - An open-source platform for managing and monitoring MySQL performance.
*   [phpMyAdmin (‚≠ê7.6k)](https://github.com/phpmyadmin/phpmyadmin) - a free software tool written in PHP, intended to handle the administration of MySQL over the Web.

### HA

*   [Galera Cluster (‚≠ê477)](https://github.com/codership/galera) - a true Multimaster Cluster based on synchronous replication.
*   [mha4mysql-node (‚≠ê407)](https://github.com/yoshinorim/mha4mysql-node) and [mha4mysql-manager (‚≠ê1.5k)](https://github.com/yoshinorim/mha4mysql-manager) (both unmaintained) - Master High Availability Manager and tools for MySQL.
*   [Orchestrator (‚≠ê5.7k)](https://github.com/openark/orchestrator) - MySQL replication topology management and High Availability solution.

### Proxy

*   [MySQL Proxy (‚≠ê425)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-proxy) (deprecated) - A simple program that sits between your client and MySQL server(s) that can monitor, analyze or transform their communication.
*   [ProxySQL (‚≠ê6.3k)](https://github.com/sysown/proxysql) - High performance proxy for MySQL.

### Server

*   [Percona Server (‚≠ê1.2k)](https://github.com/percona/percona-server) - An enhanced, drop-in MySQL replacement.

### Sharding

*   [Jetpants (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/tumblr/jetpants) - An automation suite for managing large range sharding clusters, by Tumblr.
*   [Vitess (‚≠ê20k)](https://github.com/vitessio/vitess) - vitess provides servers and tools which facilitate scaling of MySQL databases for large scale web services.

### Toolkits

*   [MySQL Utilities (‚≠ê274)](https://github.com/mysql/mysql-utilities) (deprecated) - a collection of command-line utilities, written in Python, that are used for maintaining and administering MySQL servers, either individually, or within Replication hierarchies.
*   [Percona Toolkit (‚≠ê1.3k)](https://github.com/percona/percona-toolkit) - a collection of advanced command-line tools to perform a variety of MySQL server and system tasks that are too difficult or complex to perform manually.
items.content_html:
Analysis

  • Prometheus (‚≠ê59k)/mysqld_exporter (‚≠ê2.3k) - Time series database for real-time monitoring and alerting.

Benchmarking

  • iibench-mysql (‚≠ê46) - Java based version of the Index Insertion Benchmark for MySQL/Percona/MariaDB.

Connectors

  • DBD::MariaDB (‚≠ê35) - MariaDB and MySQL driver for the Perl5 Database Interface.
  • DBD::mysql (‚≠ê64) - MySQL driver for the Perl5 Database Interface.

  • MySQL C API - Official C driver for MySQL.
  • MySQL Connector/C++ (‚≠ê677) - Official C/C++ driver for MySQL.
  • MySQL Connector/J (‚≠ê964) - a standardized database driver for the Java platforms and development.
  • MySQL Connector/NET (‚≠ê309) - a standardized database driver for .Net platforms and development.
  • MySQL Connector/Node.js (‚≠ê158) - Official Node.js driver for MySQL.
  • MySQL Connector/Python (‚≠ê913) - a standardized database driver for Python platforms and development.
  • mysqlclient-python (‚≠ê2.5k) - MySQL database connector for Python.
  • PHP mysqlnd - MySQL native driver for PHP.

Deployment

Development

GUI

  • Adminer (‚≠ê6.9k) - Database management in a single PHP file.
  • DBeaver (‚≠ê44k) - A cross-platform SQL and NoSQL database client.
  • HeidiSQL (‚≠ê5.3k) - MySQL GUI frontend for Windows.
  • MySQL Shell (‚≠ê206) - Advanced client and code editor for MySQL that supports development and administration for the MySQL Server and MySQL InnoDB cluster (AdminAPI) with an interactive JavaScript, Python, or SQL interface.
  • MySQL Workbench (‚≠ê950) - provides DBAs and developers an integrated tools environment for database design & modeling; SQL devleopment; database administration.
  • OmniDB: Web tool for database management (‚≠ê3.2k)
  • Percona Monitoring and Management (‚≠ê797) - An open-source platform for managing and monitoring MySQL performance.
  • phpMyAdmin (‚≠ê7.6k) - a free software tool written in PHP, intended to handle the administration of MySQL over the Web.

HA

  • Galera Cluster (‚≠ê477) - a true Multimaster Cluster based on synchronous replication.
  • mha4mysql-node (‚≠ê407) and mha4mysql-manager (‚≠ê1.5k) (both unmaintained) - Master High Availability Manager and tools for MySQL.
  • Orchestrator (‚≠ê5.7k) - MySQL replication topology management and High Availability solution.

Proxy

  • MySQL Proxy (‚≠ê425) (deprecated) - A simple program that sits between your client and MySQL server(s) that can monitor, analyze or transform their communication.
  • ProxySQL (‚≠ê6.3k) - High performance proxy for MySQL.

Server

  • Percona Server (‚≠ê1.2k) - An enhanced, drop-in MySQL replacement.

Sharding

  • Jetpants (‚≠ê1.1k) - An automation suite for managing large range sharding clusters, by Tumblr.
  • Vitess (‚≠ê20k) - vitess provides servers and tools which facilitate scaling of MySQL databases for large scale web services.

Toolkits

  • MySQL Utilities (‚≠ê274) (deprecated) - a collection of command-line utilities, written in Python, that are used for maintaining and administering MySQL servers, either individually, or within Replication hierarchies.
  • Percona Toolkit (‚≠ê1.3k) - a collection of advanced command-line tools to perform a variety of MySQL server and system tasks that are too difficult or complex to perform manually.

items.title: Awesome Angular
items.content_text:
### Blogs / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular.love](https://angular.love/) - (Polish) Excellent up-to-date resource for Angular.
*   [Tim Deschryver](https://timdeschryver.dev/)
*   [Matthieu Riegler](https://riegler.fr/)
*   [ng serve](https://www.ngserve.io/)

### Community

*   [angular space](https://www.angularspace.com/) - Your Hub for Learning and Growing as an Angular Developer.

### X / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [Muhammad Ahsan Ayaz](https://x.com/codewith_ahsan)
*   [Dmytro Mezhenskyi](https://x.com/DecodedFrontend)

### YouTube Channels / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [Procademy](https://www.youtube.com/@procademy)
*   [Code Shots With Profanis](https://www.youtube.com/@CodeShotsWithProfanis)
*   [Learning Partner](https://www.youtube.com/@LearningPartnerDigital)
*   [Code Deck](https://www.youtube.com/@codedeck)
*   [Igor Sedov](https://www.youtube.com/@theigorsedov)
*   [Demystify Frontend](https://www.youtube.com/@DemystifyFrontend)

### Integrations / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [NativeScript](https://docs.nativescript.org) - NativeScript provides platform APIs directly to the JavaScript runtime (with strong types) for a rich TypeScript development experience.
*   [ngx-grapesjs (‚≠ê23)](https://github.com/Developer-Plexscape/ngx-grapesjs) - Angular wrapper library for [GrapesJS](https://grapesjs.com).
*   [gojs-angular (‚≠ê66)](https://github.com/NorthwoodsSoftware/gojs-angular) - A set of Angular components to manage [GoJS](https://gojs.net/latest/index.html) Diagrams, Palettes, and Overviews.

### Free / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [zen (‚≠ê208)](https://github.com/ZenSoftware/zen) - Nest + Prisma + Apollo + Angular Full Stack GraphQL Starter Kit.
*   [Colorlib](https://colorlib.com/wp/free-angular-templates/)
*   [HTMLrev](https://htmlrev.com/free-angular-templates.html)

### Paid / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [Admin Mart](https://adminmart.com/templates/angular-dashboard/)

### Animations / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ng-auto-animate (‚≠ê12)](https://github.com/ajitzero/ng-auto-animate) - Angular Directive (library) for FormKit's [Auto Animate](https://auto-animate.formkit.com).
*   [layout-projection (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/Char2sGu/layout-projection) - Beautify the Web with awesome layout animations.
*   [ngx-easy-view-transitions (‚≠ê6)](https://github.com/DerStimmler/ngx-easy-view-transitions) - Angular library for easier use of the View Transitions API.

### Charts / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-echarts (‚≠ê1.1k)](https://github.com/xieziyu/ngx-echarts) - Angular directive for [Apache ECharts (‚≠ê64k)](https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts).

### DOM / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-sharebuttons (‚≠ê536)](https://github.com/MurhafSousli/ngx-sharebuttons) - Angular share buttons.

### Editor Components / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [acrodata/code-editor (‚≠ê41)](https://github.com/acrodata/code-editor) - CodeMirror 6 wrapper for Angular.

### File Upload / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [file-upload (‚≠ê88)](https://github.com/pIvan/file-upload) - Angular module used for file upload.

### Form Controls / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular-code-input (‚≠ê187)](https://github.com/AlexMiniApps/angular-code-input) - Robust and tested code (number/chars) input component for Angular 7 - 16+ projects. Ionic 4 - 7+ is supported, can be used in iOS and Android. Clipboard events are supported.

### Keyboard Mouse / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-contextmenu (‚≠ê43)](https://github.com/PerfectMemory/ngx-contextmenu) - A context menu component for Angular.

### Loaders / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [dotglitch-ngx (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/knackstedt/dotglitch-ngx/tree/main/packages/common/src/components/lazy-loader) - Highly customizable lazy loader for Angular components.
*   [angular-svg-round-progressbar (‚≠ê739)](https://github.com/crisbeto/angular-svg-round-progressbar) - Angular module that uses SVG to create a circular progressbar.

### Mixed utilities / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ts-cacheable (‚≠ê343)](https://github.com/angelnikolov/ts-cacheable) - A popular platform-agnostic caching library.
*   [ngify (‚≠ê146)](https://github.com/ngify/ngify) - Use Angular features outside of Angular.

### Additional / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [query (‚≠ê46k)](https://github.com/TanStack/query) - Powerful asynchronous state management, server-state utilities and data fetching for the web.

### Storage / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [ngx-indexed-db (‚≠ê186)](https://github.com/assuncaocharles/ngx-indexed-db) - Wraps IndexedDB in an Angular service.

### Unspecified / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [winonang (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/winona-ui/winonang) - Part of the Winona UI suite, aimed at providing seamless UI components for Angular developers. Our goal is to ensure that these components work flawlessly on Windows, but they are designed to be cross-platform compatible as well.

### Misc Components / [Google Developer Experts](https://developers.google.com/experts/all/technology/web-technologies)

*   [angular-tag-cloud-module (‚≠ê42)](https://github.com/d-koppenhagen/angular-tag-cloud-module) - With this module, you can generate word clouds / tag clouds.
*   [ngx-parallax-stars (‚≠ê5)](https://github.com/DerStimmler/ngx-parallax-stars) - Angular library to create beautiful stars with parallax effect.
*   [angular-twitter-timeline (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/mustafaer/angular-twitter-timeline) - Angular Public Twitter Timeline Widget.

Misc Components / Google Developer Experts

items.title: Awesome Agi Cocosci
items.content_text:
### Domain Specific Language / Imperative DSL Applications

*   [KnitScript: A Domain-Specific Scripting Language for Advanced Machine Knitting](https://dl.acm.org/doi/abs/10.1145/3586183.3606789) - ***UIST'23***, 2023. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?hl=en\&as_sdt=0%2C5\&q=KnitScript%3A+A+Domain-Specific+Scripting+Language+for+Advanced+Machine+Knitting\&btnG=)]. \[[Project](https://pypi.org/project/knit-script/)]. This paper presents KnitScript, a domain-specific machine knitting scripting language that supports computationally driven knitting designs. KnitScript provides a comprehensive virtual model of knitting machines, giving access to machine-level capabilities as they are needed while automating a variety of tedious and error-prone details.
*   [A domain‚Äëspecifc language framework for farm management information systems in precision agriculture](https://link.springer.com/article/10.1007/s11119-020-09770-y) - ***Precision Agriculture***, 2020. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=1495954486695213496)]. This paper proposes a domain-specific language framework for the design and development of precision-agriculture FMISs, which copes with challenges on supporting the understandability, enhancing communication and analysis of the design decisions, and the communication among stakeholders.

### Domain Specific Language / Declarative DSL Applications

*   [PClean: Bayesian Data Cleaning at Scale with Domain-Specific Probabilistic Programming](https://proceedings.mlr.press/v130/lew21a.html) - ***ICML'21***, 2021. \[[All Versions](https://scholar.google.com/scholar?cluster=2892523061439714130)]. This work presents PClean, a probabilistic programming language (PPL) for leveraging dataset-specific knowledge to automate Bayesian cleaning, automating Bayesian approaches given the diversity of real-world error patterns and the hardness of inference.

### Domain Specific Language / Logic DSL Applications

*   [Situation Calculus](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Situation_calculus) - ***Wikipedia***. Wikipedia on Situation Calculus, a logic formalism designed for representing and reasoning about dynamical domains.
items.content_html:
Domain Specific Language / Imperative DSL Applications

  • KnitScript: A Domain-Specific Scripting Language for Advanced Machine Knitting - UIST'23, 2023. [All Versions]. [Project]. This paper presents KnitScript, a domain-specific machine knitting scripting language that supports computationally driven knitting designs. KnitScript provides a comprehensive virtual model of knitting machines, giving access to machine-level capabilities as they are needed while automating a variety of tedious and error-prone details.
  • A domain‚Äëspecifc language framework for farm management information systems in precision agriculture - Precision Agriculture, 2020. [All Versions]. This paper proposes a domain-specific language framework for the design and development of precision-agriculture FMISs, which copes with challenges on supporting the understandability, enhancing communication and analysis of the design decisions, and the communication among stakeholders.

Domain Specific Language / Declarative DSL Applications

  • PClean: Bayesian Data Cleaning at Scale with Domain-Specific Probabilistic Programming - ICML'21, 2021. [All Versions]. This work presents PClean, a probabilistic programming language (PPL) for leveraging dataset-specific knowledge to automate Bayesian cleaning, automating Bayesian approaches given the diversity of real-world error patterns and the hardness of inference.

Domain Specific Language / Logic DSL Applications

  • Situation Calculus - Wikipedia. Wikipedia on Situation Calculus, a logic formalism designed for representing and reasoning about dynamical domains.

items.title: Awesome Zsh Plugins
items.content_text:
### Generic ZSH

*   [Profiling ZSH](https://ellie.wtf/notes/profiling-zsh) - Good article about profiling your ZSH setup to optimize startup time.

### Plugins / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [git-patch (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/marvinroman/oh-my-zsh-git-patch-plugin) - Adds custom functions and aliases to the oh-my-zsh `git` plugin.
*   [gpg (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/marvinroman/oh-my-zsh-gpg-plugin) - Adds helpful aliases for using `gpg`.
*   [mkcd (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/marvinroman/oh-my-zsh-mkcd-plugin) - Allows user to create a directory and if successful, `cd` into it afterward.
*   [oh-my-posh-manager (‚≠ê4)](https://github.com/wintermi/zsh-oh-my-posh) - Manages the oh-my-posh theme engine, along with providing a default powerline-like theme.

### Themes / [superconsole](https://github.com/alexchmykhalo/superconsole) - Windows-only

*   [minimal-os (‚≠ê3)](https://github.com/nkurata/zsh-theme) - A minimalist prompt with helpful `git` status and system-specific decorators.
*   [moon-lite (‚≠ê0)](https://github.com/anotherlusitano/moon-light) - Minimalist. Includes decorators for `git` status, current directory and the exit status of the last command run.
*   [themer (‚≠ê1)](https://github.com/MrRedacted/zsh-themer) - Includes multiple color scheme options, with `git` status decorators. There are also multiple icons to choose from within the `.zsh-theme` file. Based on [strug (‚≠ê2)](https://github.com/triplepointfive/oh-my-zsh/blob/master/themes/strug.zsh-theme).
items.content_html:
Generic ZSH

  • Profiling ZSH - Good article about profiling your ZSH setup to optimize startup time.

Plugins / superconsole - Windows-only

  • git-patch (‚≠ê0) - Adds custom functions and aliases to the oh-my-zsh git plugin.
  • gpg (‚≠ê0) - Adds helpful aliases for using gpg.
  • mkcd (‚≠ê1) - Allows user to create a directory and if successful, cd into it afterward.
  • oh-my-posh-manager (‚≠ê4) - Manages the oh-my-posh theme engine, along with providing a default powerline-like theme.

Themes / superconsole - Windows-only

  • minimal-os (‚≠ê3) - A minimalist prompt with helpful git status and system-specific decorators.
  • moon-lite (‚≠ê0) - Minimalist. Includes decorators for git status, current directory and the exit status of the last command run.
  • themer (‚≠ê1) - Includes multiple color scheme options, with git status decorators. There are also multiple icons to choose from within the .zsh-theme file. Based on strug (‚≠ê2).

items.title: Awesome Neovim
items.content_text:
### Snippet / Diagnostics

*   [guilherme-puida/tesoura.nvim (‚≠ê28)](https://github.com/guilherme-puida/tesoura.nvim) - A flexible snippet system using Neovim's new snippet API.

### File Explorer / Diagnostics

*   [neotree-file-nesting-config (‚≠ê18)](https://github.com/saifulapm/neotree-file-nesting-config) - Pre-defined file nesting rules for `neo-tree.nvim`.

### Tree-sitter Supported Colorscheme / Diagnostics

*   [uloco/bluloco.nvim (‚≠ê386)](https://github.com/uloco/bluloco.nvim) - A fancy and sophisticated colorscheme for night and day coding. Supports LSP, Tree-sitter and all the plugins you love.
